DOC.brief_summary: Human Papillomavirus ( HPV ) common sexually transmitted infection cause cancer ( anal , penile , oropharyngeal ) genital wart men . Due sexual practice ( e.g. , receptive anal intercourse ) , men sex men ( MSM ) particularly high risk HPV infection disproportionately affect HPV-related cancer . A safe effective vaccine available prevent HPV infection , yet HPV vaccination rate U.S. low , particularly among male . To remedy gap , goal study develop pilot test text message intervention increase HPV vaccination young MSM . The study two specific aim : 1 . Develop , iteratively refine , pre-test message use formative research procedure design target health intervention . The procedure consist follow step : 1 ) conduct online focus group , online survey , in-depth interview inform message content , 2 ) draft initial message base focus group finding pilot data , 3 ) refine message content ass acceptability use content advisory team , 4 ) conduct internal alpha test ensure software functionality , 5 ) beta test protocol . 2 . Test feasibility , acceptability , preliminary efficacy Txt2Protect ( T2P ) text message intervention pilot randomize control trial ( RCT ) . To achieve aim , 460 unvaccinated MSM ( age 18-26 ) live Chicago metro area randomly assign treatment ( T2P ) control condition . The treatment condition receive culturally appropriate text messaging-based HPV vaccination intervention base Information , Motivation , Behavioral Skills model , whereas control condition receive text messaging-based sexual health intervention include basic fact HPV vaccination readily accessible online . Primary outcome measure include intervention feasibility ( e.g. , retention trial ) , acceptability ( satisfaction intervention ) , preliminary efficacy determine initiation ( receipt first dose ) completion 3-dose HPV vaccine series end 9-month trial . The study team hypothesize participant T2P condition ( vs. control ) report great acceptability intervention significantly likely initiate complete 3-dose HPV vaccine series end trial .
DOC.brief_title: Txt2Protect : Using Text Messaging Increase HPV Vaccination Among Young Sexual Minority Men
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Participants must : 1 . Be male ( sex birth gender identity ) 2 . Selfidentify gay , bisexual , queer 3 . Be English speak 4 . Live Chicago metro area 5 . Be exclusive owner cell phone 6 . Have use text messaging least 6 month 7 . Plan cell phone number next 9 month 8 . Be enrol unlimited text messaging plan Exclusion Criteria Participants must previously vaccinate HPV .
